field.description: If true, repository is browseable on UI/DAV. With any value repository will still properly serve Maven clients.

field.name: offline
field.description: If true, repository will never try to reach it's remote peer. Will offer the content it has in cache/local store.

field.name: indexable
field.description: If true, repository will get indexed. If false, the files and artifacts from repository will NOT appear on Nexus index, thus will be not searcheable (and browseable on views that relies on index), altough it will serve Maven clients properly.

field.description: NotFoundCache, the neg-cache records time to live in minutes. How long will misses be cached.

field.name: artifactMaxAge
field.description: Max. minutes that have to pass before Nexus will look to remote peer for possibly new version of artifact.

field.name: metadataMaxAge
field.description: Max. minutes that have to pass before Nexus will look to remote peer for possibly new version of repository metadata.

field.name: itemMaxAge
field.description: Max. minutes that have to pass before Nexus will look to remote peer for possibly new version of cached file.

field.name: shouldServeReleases
field.description: If true, repository will serve requests for released artifacts.

field.name: shouldServeSnapshots
field.description: If true, repository will serve requests for snapshot artifacts.

field.name: maintainProxiedRepositoryMetadata
field.description: If true, repository will fix/maintain repository metadata (according to it's repositoryType) that is coming from it's remote store (this setting does not affect hosted reposes). Beware, this setting is modifying the repo metadata!

field.name: repositoryPolicy
field.description: The type of repository, it may have "release" or "snapshot" values allowing it to host/proxy/server release or snapshot artifacts only.

field.name: checksumPolicy
field.description: The checksum policy of this repository (used on proxies only). Valid values are: 'ignore' (simply ignore checksums), 'warn' (warn in logs on wrong checksums but serve it), 'strict' (strict checksumming, on bad or missing remote checksum the artifact is not served) and 'strictIfExists' (like 'strict' if hash exists remotely or warn if not exists).

field.description: The remote storage definition of repository. It not defined, the repository will be Nexus-hosted. If defined at least the remote URL, the repository will be proxy-repository.
